title: Homotopy is a large-scale rope sculpture inspired by the mathematical fields of topology and knot theory. The sculpture is composed of three separate bands of rope webbing intertwined together to form a Borromean braid
caption: This work was built and displayed at Ropecraft Chicago 2019, where Marceline was invited as an Artist-in-Residence.

img_alt: A large rope sculpture on a black background

title: The life of an object
caption: As the viewer interacts with the sculpture, the shape and tension in the rope changes. Although the design is geometric in nature, its form is still organic, responding to participants with a life of its own.
Modeling by Anya Demure, Rope and Photo by Marceline VQ
